question: 他
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading. When learning the kanji, you didn't learn that reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you with this word: 

You need to go for a drive to the public gardens, but you aren't going to get your normal car, you're going to get your <kanji>other</kanji> car. Your <reading>hoe car</reading> (<ja>ほか</ja>)! It's a car made entirely out of garden hoes. You can drive it and hoe with it at the same time! Your other car can't do that!
